articles.title: $83,000 in jewelry stolen from California Bloomingdale's
articles.description: PALO ALTO, Calif. (AP) — Thieves smashed display cases at a San Francisco Bay Area Bloomingdale's and got away with $83,000 worth of jewelry, police said Thursday.
articles.content:
PALO ALTO, Calif. (AP) Thieves smashed display cases at a San Francisco Bay Area Bloomingdale's and got away with $83,000 worth of jewelry, police said Thursday.

articles.title: As Iran and US take step back from the brink, Canada grieves
articles.description: TORONTO (AP) — The worst had passed, it seemed, and the United States and Iran no longer appeared poised at the edge of war.
articles.content:
TORONTO (AP) The worst had passed, it seemed, and the United States and Iran no longer appeared poised at the edge of war.

articles.title: Medical board OKs up to $200K to review sex misconduct cases
articles.description: COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) — The State Medical Board of Ohio has approved spending up to $150,000 more on a review of about 2,000 closed cases of alleged sexual misconduct or impropriety by doctors.
articles.content:
COLUMBUS, Ohio (AP) The State Medical Board of Ohio has approved spending up to $150,000 more on a review of about 2,000 closed cases of alleged sexual misconduct or impropriety by doctors.

articles.title: Court to decide on public tuition for religious schools
articles.description: BOSTON (AP) — A panel of appeals court justices will decide whether the state of Maine should pay for three families to send their children to religious schools because they live in districts that lack high schools.
articles.content:
BOSTON (AP) A panel of appeals court justices will decide whether the state of Maine should pay for three families to send their children to religious schools because they live in districts that lack high schools.

articles.title: On streets of Tehran, relief for now at no wider conflict
articles.description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iranian newspapers proclaimed the country's attack on U.S. forces in Iraq to be "a dark night for Americans," and Washington's "first admission of failure in history." On the bustling streets of Tehran, however, there was relief…

articles.author: MICHAEL WAGAMAN Associated Press
articles.title: California holds off Washington State 73-66
articles.description: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) — Matt Bradley scored a career-high 26 points and had 10 rebounds, and California held off a late surge to beat Washington State 73-66 on Thursday night for the Golden Bears’ first win in nearly a month.
articles.content:
California: The Bears need any win they can get and this was a nice bounce back for Foxs team after they dropped their Pac-12 opener against Stanford. Bradley had his best game yet and has scored in double figures in every game this season but one.

articles.title: Kansas farmers are using bees again to increase crop health
articles.description: WINDOM, Kan. (AP) — With a nudge toward the past, Kansas farms are using bees once again to increase crop health.

articles.description: BANGOR, Maine (AP) — The federal government has awarded more than $13 million to Maine's state government, the city of Bangor and several organizations in the state to help reduce homelessness.
